column2: Activist Ackman says Allergan CEO has conflict over letting goUPDATE 3-Ackman: Allergan CEO has conflict of interest on takeover offer (Adds Allergan board letter to Ackman
column3: closing share prices)  UPDATE 3-Ackman: Allergan CEO has conflict of interest on takeover offer (Adds Allergan board letter to Ackman
column4: closing share prices) May 19 Activist investor William Ackman said on Monday in a letter to takeover target Allergan Inc's  board of directors that the top executive has a "disabling" conflict of interest because accepting a takeover means losing the top job.UPDATE 3-Ackman: Allergan CEO has conflict of interest on takeover offer (Adds Allergan board letter to Ackman

column4: whose filing led to a 20-percent one-day plunge in the bank's stock price.

column1710: May 19 Latin American stocks dropped on Monday as a decline in iron ore prices hammered shares of Brazilian miner Vale while America Movil drove losses in Mexico's bourse after AT&T; said it would sell its stake in the Mexican telecommunications firm.     The broader MSCI Latin American stock index  nearly erased the previous session's gains though most of the region's currencies strengthened slightly against the dollar. column4270: biotech names lift Nasdaq * Dow up 0.1 pct; S&P; 500 up 0.4 pct; Nasdaq up 0.9 pct   (Updates to close)       By Asher Levine     SAO PAULO
column4271: May 19 Latin American stocks dropped on Monday as a decline in iron ore prices hammered shares of Brazilian miner Vale while America Movil drove losses in Mexico's bourse after AT&T; said it would sell its stake in the Mexican telecommunications firm.     The broader MSCI Latin American stock index  nearly erased the previous session's gains though most of the region's currencies strengthened slightly against the dollar. column6835: May 19 Latin American stocks dropped on Monday as a decline in iron ore prices hammered shares of Brazilian miner Vale while America Movil drove losses in Mexico's bourse after AT&T; said it would sell its stake in the Mexican telecommunications firm.     The broader MSCI Latin American stock index  nearly erased the previous session's gains though most of the region's currencies strengthened slightly against the dollar. column2: Urban Outfitters' profit falls 20 percent May 19 Teen apparel retailer Urban Outfitters Inc reported a 20 percent fall in its quarterly profit as costs jumped.
